availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Gilbert (Pike County, Kentucky, hotelkeeper)

body.p: Pike County, Kentucky, tailor and hotelkeeper. Virginia native. Married to Lydia Ratliff Gilbert. Father of James Gilbert and Mary Gilbert. Tailor in Letcher County, Kentucky, in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Pike County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Letcher County, District 2, p. 140B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 1, p. 916.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 6, p. 74B.
